discussion_comments.comment_body:
I think we can follow the naming conventions used by some sibling commands like `argocd app get | resources`. Use long flag names (like `--resource-name, --app-namespace`)  and don't support short flag (like `-x`) except for most common ones.

```bash
$ argocd app get -h

Flags:
  -N, --app-namespace string   Only get application from namespace
      --hard-refresh           Refresh application data as well as target manifests cache
  -h, --help                   help for get
  -o, --output string          Output format. One of: json|yaml|wide|tree (default "wide")
```
i think this should be named `argocd_login_request_total` to match other counter metric names
You're right other counter metrics follow that naming convention. I'll go ahead and change it to argocd_login_request_total for consistency. Thanks for pointing it out!
